Medium Rare Books IBS

About the Intercom Brand Studio Library

Our library began in April 2018 with the aquisition of a chunk of rare books from Dave Cuzner.

Why do we have our own library?

We’re constantly bombarded on a daily basis by visual “inspiration”. New websites, rebrands etc. It can be overwhelming and tough to critically assess what parts of that can influence our work. That inspired me to think of ways that we can surface inspiration material that just doesn’t exist online. And though it is from years gone by, still influences design today. We should have access to that material.

The act of picking a book, sitting with it, enjoying it and absorbing helps us slow down and form a more thoughtful perspective on where design has been, and how it can shape our current and future work. It also acts as a counter balance to so much of the trend driven work that surrounds us.

    • Thoughts on Design 9780811875 Van Nostrand Reinhold 1970 design writing One of the seminal texts of graphic design, Paul Rand's Thoughts on Design is now available for the first time since the 1970s. Writing at the height of his career, Rand articulated in his slender volume the pioneering vision that all design should seamlessly integrate form and function. This facsimile edition preserves Rand's original 1947 essay with the adjustments he made to its text and imagery for a revised printing in 1970, and adds only an informative and inspiring new foreword by design luminary Michael Bierut. As relevant today as it was when first published, this classic treatise is an indispensable addition to the library of every designer. - summary: fun, eyeopening, classic

    Cooked just right IBS

    IBS Steak Marinade

    You got a good steak marinade recipe? "Sweet or Spicey" answers Justin Pervorse. IDK if you've ever been to E3 (the big video games expo) or seen any of the "prestige" keynotes that happen there, but it's `a lot`. Verrrry similar to tech events in their sometimes somber, always self-congratulatory grandeur. They're massive, expensive pressers that pitch their wares to the Gamers™ in a very "we get you" and "give the people what they want" sort of way.

    Ingredients
    • 1/3 cup soy sauce
    • 1/2 cup olive oil
    • 1/3 cup fresh lemon juice
    • 1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce
    • 3 tablespoons dried basil
    • 1 1/2 tablespoons dried parsley flakes
    • 1 teaspoon ground white pepper
    • 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (optional)
    • 1 teaspoon dried minced garlic (optional)
    Directions
    1. Place the soy sauce, olive oil, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, basil, parsley, and pepper in a blender. Add hot pepper sauce and garlic, if desired. Blend on high speed for 30 seconds until thoroughly mixed.
    2. Pour marinade over desired type of meat. Cover, and refrigerate for up to 8 hours. Cook meat as desired.
    Footnotes

    Tip: Aluminum foil can be used to keep food moist, cook it evenly, and make clean-up easier.
